meanings.definition: (zoology) Having the segments of the legs closely united, so as to be without distinct joints.
meanings.english_definition: (zoology) Having the segments of the legs closely united, so as to be without distinct joints.

examples.sentence: The adelarthrosomatous condition is observed in certain arthropods.
examples.translation: 無分節肢の状態は、特定の節足動物に見られる。

etymology.value: From Greek ἀ- (a-, “not”) + δῆλος (dêlos, “visible, distinct”) + ἄρθρον (árthron, “joint”) + -μα (-ma, suffix forming nouns) + -τος (-tos, adjectival suffix).
